intro: Copaiva coleosperma, commonly known as the yellow copaiva, is a shrub native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the rainforest ecosystem.
